title: Proto-Digital Gerard Unger industrial face
content:
While not mind-bogglingly impressive this super old Unger design looks sophisticated enough this if it were released this very day it would not feel out of place. (a lo-fi Kontrapunkt condesed?)

He also has readability down-packed... notice the ink traps and slabs.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821161833im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NAGO_PB00672a_X_1114608828_4054.jpg)
  
 [http://www.hetnago.nl/object.php?id=10666](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821161833/http:/www.hetnago.nl/object.php?id=10666 "http://www.hetnago.nl/object.php?id=10666")

But the best part?...

Notice his handwriting. Don’t you need that!? I do. Mr. Unger needs to digitize it right now.

Squatty x-height, low contrast, and semi-connections. What’s not to love!

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: His hand is indeed lovely. Not far from [ITC Berranger Hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821161833/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_berranger_hand_std_regular/).
